website_summaries.verdict: Long battery life, solid video quality, and a great all-in-one design make the Drift Ghost-S tough to beat.
pros: The waterproof Drift Ghost-S gives you a lot of action cam for your $399, with a built-in 2-inch LCD and Wi-Fi
a nice bundle of accessories including a wireless remote
You also get a broad set of shooting options for normal and high-speed video
cons: The back hatch, covering the battery and microSD card slot among other things, is tough to remove
Also, the menu system, while easy to understand, can be a pain to navigate

customer_reviews.title: Works well but buttons are a little unresponsive
customer_reviews.text: Its works very well but I find the buttons on the actual camera a little unresponsive (fine with the remote). For example when I turn it on I have to wait a few seconds for it to initialize, fair enough but then I want it to just start recording and get going however I'm finding I have to press and hold the button to start recording but if it's very easy to accidentally just turn it off again which is annoying, I might just need to get used to it

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality recordings
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality recordings, good quality construction but you MUST buy a micro SD card. It doesn't come with one and will not record anything without it (So pretty damn useless out of the box as a camera!). Not easy for the wifi mode where your phone/tablet can see live image or pull recordings (works but fiddly to do and resets to no wifi every time you turn the camera off). Bought to use with my bike, fixes to helmet very securely, good wide angle view and number plates incredibly clear on 1920x1080 60Hz. Smaller and neater on helmet than a Go-Pro and very easy to remove (and setup the right angle in the first place).

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality Video, Poor Design

Other than that problem, there's nothing wrong with the camera itself, quality of the video is very good, easy to mount on an Icon Variant, and the software is nifty. Shame really.

customer_reviews.title: Ignore negative critics
customer_reviews.text: Users here are unwisely dismissing what is one of the finest Action cameras available. I've had one and enjoyed using it massively. The design makes more sense than any other action camera does, the picture footage is of a high standard (even if the low light performance isn't fantastic) and the casing is designed to look and feel tough but still stylish. Although perhaps not the finest available (I'd go with the Sony Action Cam 2) it's actually nicer than GoPro's more expensive models. The price is off putting, but not as off putting as GoPro prices.

Ion-3 and gopro are far more reliable, nothing worse than going to watch your footage only to find it didn't record it all.

customer_reviews.title: Be warned!

Maybe I was just unlucky with one from a bad batch but the manufacturers refuse to accept liability for its defect and no refund offered as I have no camera to send back to them!

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera.
customer_reviews.text: This camera is fantastic! Much better than the GoPro Hero 3+, which greedily sells all of the features that come standard in the Ghost-S as accessories, which you can't even use at the same time, because they come in the form of Back-Pac attachments. Even if you spent $720 to give your GoPro optional waterproofing, WiFi, battery life almost as good as the Ghost-S, attachment needed to connect an external mic, etc.... you still wouldn't have things like the rotating lens that the Ghost-S has. GoPro has finally met its match, and Drift has put itself in position to dominate the market, once all of the GoPro fanboys realize what they're missing.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome video. Keep away from water.
customer_reviews.text: When this camera works it takes great videos and stills. My first one was in the waterproof case which leaked, which then flooded the camera and ruined it. The first time I tried to use the second one underwater, it quit and flooded after being submerged 6 inches. The battery door was sealed tight, as I had to use the tool to open and unseal it. It may have leaked around the lens, but I couldn't determine the cause. This camera takes great videos, but keep it away from any water. I am going to be looking for a new camera that is sealed well and can be used in a wet environment.

customer_reviews.title: Skip the Ghost-S
customer_reviews.text: The camera has so much potential, but falls short. First camera had yellowish blotches in the video. As though the sensor was dirty. Returned and replaced. Second camera has exposure stepping issues, and cannot be used for snow sports. The picture flickers from dark to bright like a slight strobe effect. Love the remote, don't mind the menus, but my primary use is skiing and it just is not usable. Have been told they are working on a software fix for the past 8 months. Sorry, but I cannot recommend this action cam.
customer_reviews.author: Coastal North

product_meta.title: DRIFT HD GHOST-S DIGITAL VIDEO ACTION CAMERA CAMCORDER
product_meta.description: The HD Ghost-S is the most powerful Drift camera to date – twice as powerful as its predecessor. Boasting a leading-edge processor, Sony CMOS sensor, plus 7-element aspherical lens technology, the Ghost-S is capable of 1080p at 60fps, 12MP stills and unprecedented low-light performance. The result is extraordinarily smooth, rich video in any condition. Best in class battery life (3.5 hours) means you can record more and worry less. A vivid 2" Corning Gorilla Glass scratch-resistant LCD screen further distinguish the Ghost-S from it’s competitors. Simple and intuitive, yet packed with features, the easy-to-use interface provides access to a wide variety of user-adjustable settings including, bit rate, 10x digital zoom, resolution, frame rate, exposure, field of view and manual HDMI out. Paired with an updated rotatable lens, the Ghost-S places professional-caliber features at the fingertips of casual users.
